website_summaries.verdict: Digitally transcribe in real time or sync notes at a later time. Converts into Microsoft and Adobe files.
pros: As one of the early innovators, Livescribe pens are generally quite affordable
App allows audio recordings to sync with notes
cons: Requires separate purchase of Livescribe smart pads and notebooks in order to digitize texts
Less comfortable on the hand than other pens

customer_reviews.title: Terrible when compared to earlier models.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is not nearly as good as the original live scribe that I had years ago. It’s terrible at getting reconnected to an already paired device in order to transfer notes, so I literally have pages of notes on my pen that I can’t get to my iPad. I’ve only been able to get notes to transfer back to the app twice. Additionally, the quality of the notes is terrible. While my hand writing will have smooth curves to the letters, the notes are squared off and almost look like they are made up of a series of straight lines as compared to my actual writing. I stopped using this, it’s worthless.
customer_reviews.author: spinboy

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to previous Livescribe pens
customer_reviews.text: I have had Livescribe pens for years. They are very useful because I take all my notes by hand and I find this to be an excellent method for keeping all my notes. This pen is garbage. It will not sync to your device. It takes forever to upload anything to your device. I cannot tell you how much time I spent trying to make this piece of garbage to work. I am totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dissapointed

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product... do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to update my old Livescribe Echo, to which the OLED screen went off (recurring problem of Livescribe users). Thinking that Aegir would be the solution, I found myself with bluetooth connection problems and the inability to turn off or restart the pen, after 48hrs of blinking pencil I could use it. Terrible product! Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Javier N.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Livescribe 3 pen for years. I saw the Aegir and loved the thinner size. If you get one, do yourself a favor and use it for a while at home before you take it to a weeklong conference only to discover that EVERY SINGLE TIME you use it, you have to re-pair it to your phone and lose the first few minutes of the conference you are attending. My Livescribe 3 could sit on my desk for a couple months without losing its charge. The Aegir won't last 3 days. When I need it, it's dead. I did communicate with customer service who made sure I was using the latest firmware, but it didn't fix anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jill McIntire

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 2 months. For the last two weeks after a firmware update the pen stops recording frequently. Also that image capture is now choppy. Did a master reset, power cycled it, you name it, I did it. Can't get it to work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Pipila's Design LLC

customer_reviews.title: Aegir - do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: The pen worked decently for the first month or two. The only issue was the continuous BT disconnections. After a couple of months, it stopped capturing full keystrokes, making the writing incomprehensible unless you have your pad with you (so you can read the paper). You can convert to PDF or upload but it would still be unreadable. Tried to go to the support site to open a support ticket and it basically impossible. The “Submit a request” is gone. The “live chat” is gone....... Makes you wonder!
customer_reviews.author: One Amzn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pen no longer works...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the pen, it was decent.. I used it for a while without any problems. Now, after a recent firmware update, it's useless. It requires me to push with way more pressure to record pen strokes than it did pre-firmware update. It seems like the sensor only turns on when there is constant pressure, whereas before, it was on after the initial press. Not sure what changed, but it's useless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWFUL! I had it less than 2 weeks and it no longer works. It started out great, but then 10 pages in, it couldn't track my handwriting and the synch looked like a new mysterious language with scribbles. After 23 pages, it stopped tracking all together. AND even more important, the only tech support available is online chat. No phone number, just you and everyone else chatting with one person at the same time. There's gotta be better options out there, LiveScribe is not the answer to digital writing.
customer_reviews.author: isadorah

customer_reviews.title: Really Rooting For this Pen
customer_reviews.text: I am electronic and paper - a digital smart pen is essential for me because I want to write in ink, but save digitally. The pen is finally a manageable size - feels just like a regular pen. It's gorgeous - beautiful design - and swaps easily with Cross ink. That said, it's very very glitchy. Sometimes connects easily; sometimes does not. Digital rendering of ink to digital file is HORRIBLE with this particular pen. (I've owned several livescribe devices). And that is my biggest complaint... the transfer to digital is so splotchy, that I can't read it consistently. Even got brand new notebooks to confirm. Darn! I really need a normal sized, good-looking, ink-to-digital pen.
customer_reviews.author: tonya matthews

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Emotions
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is the third Livescribe pen I've owned from the very first pen to the wireless 3. My gripe is that they can't seem to get it right. Like with each new pen they add features and take away abilities from previous models. Why can't they make a pen that has a digital display that talks ( like the first Livescribe pen), make it wireless, make it communicate with the desktop app AND the mobile app and be slim like the Aegir - With no small parts that break off or get lost? NOW! THEY'VE RELEASED A VERSION IN ALL BLACK! 😫😖
customer_reviews.author: KiKi Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to use, it does not recognize what I write and it requires too much effort even after I practice for a while. When I look at my transcripts they look very bad with lots of lines missing, almost unreadable. Also, the battery life isn't great. Definitely would not recommend this product to another person.
customer_reviews.author: Adriano

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all - meeps all the time. No way to turn that off. I contacted livescribe and they were helpful but still did not work so they have offered to replace it but not with the pen I want. If I want the same pen I will have to wait a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Operations
customer_reviews.text: It would not stay charged from one day to next. I fully charged pen on 2 occasions for important next day meeting only to find it unable to initiate next day at meeting. Also demonstrated limited handwriting recognition success. Worthless. I will stay with my Echo pens. THEY WORK.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It does not capture all the strokes
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. It is not a good product. It won't capture all of it. I write a little faster than average and it can't keep up. It writes the words missing parts. It's junk. Better get an iPad pro.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Thinner but...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the way the other pens actually record audio. This pen uses the iPhone to record. My personal preference is to have the pen perform the audio recording.
customer_reviews.author: j.sj.ca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for class
customer_reviews.text: I loved using the echo pen for undergrad, and I hope the Aegir works for grad school! It's much lighter, which is good for me since I have small hands. I'll update later with the sound quality once classes start.
customer_reviews.author: Feedback2019

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS@
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Echo for years that works flawlessly. The Aegir is under developed, buggy, has all kinds of connectivity issues and customer support sucks. Stay far away from this item.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W. Hack

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed in this. I really thought this would be the answer to spontaneous note taking. Nope. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Briana White

customer_reviews.title: Inkless
customer_reviews.text: This pen was amazing at first, but it hardly had any ink. You could barely write with the amount ofink in the pen. It was somewhat disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Leverett

customer_reviews.title: Stylish & Easy to share
customer_reviews.text: It's Livescribe! It's awesome. Haven't used one in awhile so I love the connectivity and shareability thru the phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby-Keast Family

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cost due to cheap design
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap build. Cap does not even stay on pen. Not worth the lower cost, stick with a higher priced version.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bourbon

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Bought the pen as a gift for my wife. When she tried to use it, she received a notification that a software update was required prior to use, but it would not process the update. So, we were unable to use the pen and had to return it. Will look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: scott riehle

customer_reviews.title: Smooth writing
customer_reviews.text: Great pen! Smooth writing instrument and much better aesthically appealing live scribe. First live scribe pen with pizazz! style! It is a go to pen in meetings
customer_reviews.author: K Revolt

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.text: This pen stopped working and they no longer give support on the Aegir Smart pen.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Arreola

customer_reviews.title: I love this smartpen.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pen. I rarely write reviews, but the Livescribe pen has exceeded my expectations in every area.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Tried updating firmware, still stinks. Look at the pictures. Misses half of the lines unless you just draw strait lines.
customer_reviews.author: THEODORE C BROCK

customer_reviews.title: Thinner, lighter, better ink...
customer_reviews.text: There are things I'd fix re. the way it works with external apps like OneNote and there are annoying things in the design (the pen lid doesn't click firmly on the back and can fall off if you hold your pen and gesticulate while talking in meetings like I do), but it does what it's supposed to do and is light and easy to hold - overall feels less substantial (too light) even though they say it's much stronger. Still the best handwriting recognition I have found, but it's a work in progress in other ways. Well worth it in general.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had never bought this pen - I hate it
customer_reviews.text: The Pros - 1. It looks good 2. Feels good The Cons - 1. It cannot voice record unless you follow the fidgety way of using your pen and iPad or iPhone together 2. The Livescribe+ App is very fidgety. Each time I use the App I need to re-register my pen. So simply stated, it doesn't work 3. For some reason, it doesn't always pick up all my writing Verdict - Give this pen a hard pass and save your money. There's a good reason why this is one of the cheaper pens on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda van den Berg

customer_reviews.title: RIP Livescribe
customer_reviews.text: This would have been my third generation of livescribe pen. It, however, doesn't work. It fails to capture writing, feels and looks like cheap plastic garbage, and there's no reasonable way to just turn the damned thing off to conserve battery. Did this thing even ever go through testing? Going to have to reevaluate my notes paradigm now because livescribe has officially blown it. They've killed something great. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah F.

customer_reviews.title: A Christmas  Abomination
customer_reviews.text: Firmware will not update. The update just hangs at 0%. The battery drains remarkable quickly. Does not appear to auto-off. If you do not leave it plugged in overnight it is dead in the morning. Email only support? Really? I have used the Echo and LS 3 extensively and this is a massive let down.
customer_reviews.author: No Desktop Application?

customer_reviews.title: Great - when it works
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a previous review giving one star. The pen just didn't work. The company sent me a new one. This one works just great. I did have to download new firmware, but that was easy. Very satisfied with this pen. I used to workwith the Echo, but that one is too big and bulky for my taste. This is like writing with a normal pen and recording at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Jan A. Bletz

product_meta.title: Livescribe Aegir Smartpen, Marlin Edition, Teal Color (APX-00031)
product_meta.description: Color:Teal| Style:Marlin EditionAegir Smart pen delivers the traditional benefits of pen and paper combined with all the power of digital notes. The pen uses Bluetooth to automatically sync data with both mobile (iOS and Android) and desktop (Windows) devices using the free live scribe+ companion app.
feature_bullets: Digitize your handwritten notes effortlessly. At almost the same size and weight as a ball-point pen, digitally transforming your handwriting has never been easier, or more fashionable
Add voice to your notes. Record audio using the Livescribe+ app while you write to add voice to your notes. Playback when needed to recreate key moments
Write now, sync later. Capture every moment – The Aegir smartpen can store up to 1,200 pages of writing and sync later with your phone
Search for terms within your handwriting. Use the Livescribe+ app to search your handwritten notes and find what you need, when you need it. Custom tags keep your notes organized.

Seamlessly integrate the Aegir smartpen into your life. Share notes in the format that you want (Text/PDF/image/MS Word) to the cloud service that you use (Dropbox/Google Drive/MS OneNote/Evernote). Digitize across boundaries. The Aegir smartpen can recognize 22 languages in your handwriting and digitally transcribe in real-time
